channel.title: [PI] quests directory
channel.description:
hey guys so basicly im kinda new to pi and im not to sure on setting up directories. i set this up like it would be for delta and its not working. ive looked around at other files and couldnt see anything wrong. this is basicly the base for my quests. if u can see whts wrong with my compiler please point out.
[code]src\server\model\players\quests.java:5: error: class xmasQuest is public, should be declared in a file named xmasQuest.java public class xmasQuest { ^ src\server\model\players\quests.java:3: error: cannot find symbol import server.model.players; ^ symbol: class players location: package server.model src\server\model\players\quests.java:7: error: cannot find symbol public static void showQuest(Client c) { ^ symbol: class Client location: class xmasQuest Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
i litterally looked at a tutorial for this and it said to do the exact same way.

item.title: [PI] quests directory
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

  1. This isn’t helpful to your situation, but I recommend you don’t use PI… Ever.
  2. Make sure your Imports are correct and you have the ones needed. If you followed a Tutorial, make sure you review your work to the letter.

Read full topic
